lines.content: This iP used AI tools in the following ways:
- **JavaDoc & code quality**: Generated/edited JavaDoc comments and suggested small refactors
- **Bug fixing**: Helped diagnose compile errors in some methods
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/yuri.Yuri.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run yuri.Yuri.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
// JavaFX 17.0.7 with OS-specific classifiers (from the SE-EDU tutorial)

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
// nice, predictable name for your release upload

Yuri is a light weight tasks chatbot with a clean JavaFX UI. It supports **todos**, **deadlines**, and **events**, plus **list**, **find**, **mark/unmark**, and **delete**. Data is saved automatically to `data/duke.txt` (created on first run).
Adds a task with a due date (ISO format `yyyy-mm-dd`). The task appears in the list with a `[D]` tag and the date formatted (e.g., `Dec 2 2019`).
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Adds a task with only a description. The task appears with a `[T]` tag.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds a task with a start and end date (ISO format). The task appears with an `[E]` tag and a `from ... to ...` range.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Shows all tasks in order, numbered from 1.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Marks a task as done using its number from `list`.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Marks a task as not done.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Removes a task by its number.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list
Searches for tasks whose descriptions contain a keyword (case-insensitive).
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
Requires Java 17 and the fat JAR (`yuri.jar`).
* Entry point that launches JavaFX without tripping up classloader/module issues.
* Utility methods for interpreting raw user input lines.
* Provides helpers to detect commands, slice arguments, and validate indices.
* Returns true if {@code line} starts with the whole word {@code word} (case-insensitive).
* Accepts either an exact match or a leading word followed by a space.
* @return true if the first word matches; false otherwise
public boolean startsWithWord(String line, String word) {
assert line != null && word != null : "Null inputs to startsWithWord";
* Returns the substring of {@code line} after the head command word.
* Trims surrounding whitespace; returns empty string if nothing remains.
* @return the argument substring after the command word (trimmed), or empty string
public String sliceAfter(String line, String headWord) {
assert line != null && headWord != null : "Null inputs to sliceAfter";
assert out != null : "sliceAfter: result should not be null";
* Splits {@code s} once around the first occurrence of {@code token}.
* Returns a 2-element array {@code [left, right]} with {@code right} trimmed.
* @param token  the delimiter token (case-insensitive, as implemented)
* @param errMsg error message to use if the token is not found
* @return two parts: left of the token, and right of the token (trimmed)
* @throws yuri.Yuri.YuriException if the token cannot be found
public String[] splitOnceOrThrow(String s, String token, String errMsg) throws Yuri.YuriException {
assert s != null && token != null && errMsg != null : "Null inputs to splitOnceOrThrow";
assert left != null && right != null : "Split parts should be non-null";
* Finds {@code token} in {@code s} case-insensitively; tolerates a leading space before token.
* @return index of match, or -1 if not found
public int indexOfToken(String s, String token) {
assert s != null && token != null : "Null inputs to indexOfToken";
assert s.regionMatches(true, i, token, 0, token.length()) : "Case-insensitive match must align";
assert s.regionMatches(true, j, token, 0, token.length()) : "Case-insensitive match must align (spaced)";
* Parses and returns a 1-based index from a command of the form {@code "<cmd> <number>"}.
* Must have exactly one numeric argument.
* @param cmd  the command word (used only for error messages)
* @throws yuri.Yuri.YuriException if format is wrong or the number is not a positive integer
public int parseIndexOrThrow(String line, String cmd) throws Yuri.YuriException {
assert line != null && cmd != null : "Null inputs to parseIndexOrThrow";
throw new Yuri.YuriException("Use: '" + cmd + " <number>' with exactly one number.");
assert idx > 0 : "Parsed index must be positive";
throw new Yuri.YuriException("Index must be a positive number. Example: '" + cmd + " 2'.");
* Handles persistence of tasks to and from the save file on disk.
* The file format is the simple pipe-separated format produced by each task's {@code toSaveFormat()}.
* Creates a {@code Storage} that reads/writes to the given path.
* @param filePath path of the save file, e.g. {@code data/duke.txt}
assert filePath != null : "Storage filePath must not be null";

*

If the file does not exist, it is created and an empty list is returned.
* @return list of tasks loaded from disk (possibly empty)
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs while creating/reading the file
assert file != null : "File ref must not be null";
assert file.exists() || created : "File should exist or be created";
assert line != null : "Read line should not be null";
// task may be null for malformed lines by design
assert tasks != null : "Loaded task list should not be null";
* Saves the given tasks to disk, overwriting any existing content.
* @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs while writing
public void save(List<Yuri.Task> tasks) throws IOException {
assert tasks != null : "Tasks to save must not be null";
assert task != null : "Individual task must not be null";
assert line != null : "toSaveFormat must not return null";
assert line != null : "parseTask input line must not be null";
assert type != null && !type.isEmpty() : "Task type must be present";
assert p.length >= 5 : "Event requires start and end dates";
assert t != null : "Constructed task should not be null";
* Holds and manages the list of tasks in memory.
* Provides basic operations such as add, remove, mark, and unmark.
* Constructs a task list initialized with the given tasks.
assert initial != null : "Initial task list must not be null";
* Adds a task to the end of the list.
* Returns the task at the given zero-based index.
* @param idx0 zero-based index of the task
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if {@code idx0} is out of range
assert idx0 >= 0 && idx0 < tasks.size() : "Index out of bounds";
* Removes and returns the task at the given zero-based index.
* @param idx0 zero-based index of the task to remove
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if {@code idx0} is out of range
assert idx0 >= 0 && idx0 < tasks.size() : "Index out of bounds";
* Marks the task at the given zero-based index as done.
* @param idx0 zero-based index of the task to mark
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if {@code idx0} is out of range
* Marks the task at the given zero-based index as not done.
* @param idx0 zero-based index of the task to unmark
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if {@code idx0} is out of range
* Returns all tasks whose description contains the given keyword (case-insensitive).
* @throws IllegalArgumentException if keyword is null or blank
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Keyword cannot be empty.");
* Returns the number of tasks currently in the list.
* Returns an unmodifiable view of the tasks.
* Handles all user-facing output for the CLI: greeting, lists, confirmations, and errors.
* Centralizes formatting so core logic remains clean.

System.out.println(" Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
/** Prints the greeting header shown at program start. */
System.out.println(" What can I do for you?");
System.out.println(" (Tip: type anything to add; 'list' to see; 'mark n'/'unmark n'; 'bye' to exit.)");
/** Prints the farewell message and closing line. */
System.out.println(" Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
System.out.println(" That was funhigh five for productivity!");
* Prints a formatted error message in a consistent style.

System.out.println(" Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + newSize + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints a confirmation that a task was deleted, and shows the new list size.

System.out.println(" Now you have " + newSize + " tasks in the list.");
